title: For Sale:  BROWNING BDM 9mm LNIB W/Box...SOLD!!!
location: NE Hickory, Hickory / Lenoir, North Carolina
postcontent:
****Comes complete with its Browning original fitted hard case numbered to the gun, 2 extra magazines still in boxes, never loaded, trigger lock w/key and owners manual. Not fired a lot, it’s in near new condition.

   Browning BDM("Browning Dual Mode"), double-single action, semi-auto pistol. 4.73 inch barrel, 9MM caliber. A hard to find Browning as they were only made 1991 to 1997. 

   Ambidextrous safety, matte blue finish, black molded wrap around grips. White 3 dot sight system.

   The pistol is a magazine fed, self-loading, hammer firing type which was designed with a trigger "mode" switch installed on the left-hand side of the slide (actually only a flush inlaid disk with a bisecting groove), toggling between double-action/single-action(DA/SA) pistol mode, and the double-action-only (DAO) or "revolver" mode—though, of course, other than the similarity of the trigger mode, the BDM has no resemblance to revolvers. 
    This mode switch is what gives the handgun its name, with BDM standing for "Browning Dual Mode" or "Browning Double Mode"


   NC permit required FTF. all laws observed.

FTF preferred, however, Shipping available to out of state buyers.

no trades.

I HAVE MORE PICTURES AVAILABLE IF ANYONE IS INTERESTED.

title: For Sale:  CZ-527 American in 223 with Kevlar Composite Stock (best option for 300Whisper / 300blk build)
postcontent:
This is a brand new CZ-527 American in 223, 20" barrel, with the fantastic Single Set trigger. 

The fully adjustable set trigger works by having a normal trigger pull in not set mode, and a very light trigger pull in the set mode. When you're ready to take a shot, push the trigger forward into set mode, any additional pressure on the trigger backwards will allow accurate firing. Roughly about 1lb pull in set mode and 4lb in normal / not set mode.

This gun is new and only factory fired. I bought it originally for a conversion to 300 Whisper / 300blk which only requires a barrel change and a magazine modification. However, I don't have the time right now to even outsource that project. I'll revisit that idea at another time.

I have replaced the wood stock that comes on the American. This stock is the more expensive kevlar/fiberglass that comes standard on the 527 Varmint. This gun as is has all the benefits of the nicer stock without the by noticeable extra weight the varmint version has because of the much heavier barrel. This stock is $240 alone. The standard barrel has plenty of room to float in the larger channel, doesn't look all that bad.

I also have CZ factory rings included. Includes original factory removable magazine (5 shot). CZ-527 is based on the 1898 Mauseqr action, fully controlled feed and eject (flawless every time). 

This would make an excellent gun for a youth, varmint shooter that still wanted to be able to move around (farmer?), practical shooter, anyone looking to make a 300 Whisper / 300blk rifle (use the varmint contour at 16"), etc.

Wife says:  It is a rifle. Not that big. Black and greenish. It is, unfortunately, a bolt action.  That is about it. Has a trigger. And a barrel. Pretty light. And other stuff. I think that is all.

Thanks for looking.

3.5-21x50mm Non-Illuminated Rifle Scope 
The HDMR is a multipurpose riflescope meant for all current weapon platforms, multiple types of engagement, and versatile ranges of distance. Its long zoom ratio makes for an incredibly versatile scope. A joint offering with Bushnell Outdoor Products, the HDMR is a non-complicated, rugged, compact scope at a good price point.
At roughly two pounds and a compact 13 inches, the HDMR is one of the lightest and shortest 34mm tube scopes on the market. The larger tube allows 26 mils of elevation (5 mils per revolution), adjustable in 1/10 mil clicks with large, locking turrets that are easily turned and has a crisp feel even through gloves. It has side parallax adjustment and high quality lenses with superior, anti-reflective, Ultra Wide Band Coating that delivers 95 percent light transmission.

Made from hammer forged T6061 aluminum, the HDMR is 100 percent waterproof, fog proof, and shock proof. It's purged with Argon gas, decreasing the probability of seal corrosion.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Custom hand built ROCK RIVER H-bar ( M.S.C.A.R. ) Mini Sniper Carbine AR15 Rifle
postcontent:
Up for SALE or TRADE 


Is a like new Custom hand built & assembled from the ground up, Rock River Heavy 16" Barreled ( M.S.C.A.R ) Mini Sniper Carbine AR15 Rifle, It was all hand ( built, fitted, & assembled ) from the ground up, With all hand picked milspec. Rock River parts, Making for a more solid tighter tolerance built rifle, That is very solid feeling and very accurate, I has only had a couple magazine ever ran thru it since it was built new...


It has a milspec. airgaged Match grade machine gun rated chrome lined heavy bull barrel that is a full 1" inch diameter under the hand guards with a 1-9 twist from dti, The barrel also has a Match grade front sight gas block post with an adjustable square Match grade front sight pin & working bayonet lug, Next it has a current military style second generation milspec. Birdcage flashider, That is closed in on the bottom to keep muzzle rise down while also keeping the rifle from kicking up a dust signature when shooting from a prone position, 


The barrel has also had a full Lapping & Flowing job done on the bore, For a more consitant bullet to rifling contact down the length of the bore, Also it had a chamber polishing and bolt locking lug mating jobe done on it as well, For better feeding and ejecting of ammo and spent cartridges with a solid quicker lockup into battery position, 


Then it has a milspec. Forged wt/numbered T-marked M4 ROCK RIVER picatini flattop upper receiver, That has the more reliable M4 feedramps cut in it for better more reliable feeding of ammo into the chamber, It was mated up to a hand picked milspec. Forged LAR marked ROCK RIVER lower receiver for a close tight tolerance fit and feel between them, Making for a very solid firm feeling shooting platform with very little movement between them, 


Next it had a hand fitted and diamond stone polished single stage trigger assembly job done, With vertually no felt backlash with only an eight of an inch travel to the trigger break, Built from all hand picked and polished milspec. Rock River parts, Making for a very smooth consistant trigger action,


Then it had a milspec. original shorter style 4 position collapsible buttstock and buffer tube assembly installed on it, Making for a more compactable collapsible rifle that is easier to handle, It also had a Match grade buffer and spring assembly installed in it for less felt recoil transfered to the shooters shoulder, 


This is one sweet solid and very accurate tack driving rifle that I really really hate to get rid of, Especially before I get a chance to really accessorise and deck it out with some quad rail hand guards a nice harness style tactical sling and some nice optics, ((( NOTE ))) the Harris Swivling Bi-pods in the pictures are ((( NOT ))) included, As they belong to my daughter and goes on her rifle, I just used them to hold up this rifle to take pictures of it, 


I have almost two grand in having this piece custom hand built for me from the ground up, With the cost of all of the ( Milspec. Parts, Barrel & custom barrel lapping job, The hand fitted Diamond stone polished trigger assembly job, and Gunsmithing labor cost ), But due to needed home repairs I am listing this baby up for sale for $1350 or best offer...

Emails from Lowballers will be ignored, So please serious buyers only, Be curtious and don't waste mine or your time with lowball offers, If you want a nice piece of hardware here is your chance to get something that is very well built...

title: For Sale:  P-64 9mm x 18 makarov Polish - Great for CCW
postcontent:
This Polish P-64 was used for many years by police and military units.  The P-64 makes a very nice CCW with its compact size.  Even thought it's small, It used the powerful 9mm x 18 makarov ammunition.  There are many IWB holsters available.  The single stack magazine holds 6 plus 1 in the chamber.

This one has been modified with the Wolff Springs 20lb recoil spring and corresponding firing pin spring to reduce the recoil and make it more comfortable to shoot.  The hammer spring has been replaced with the Wolff 18lb spring to reduce the force required for the dual action trigger pull.  The lighter hammer springs also makes it easier to to work the magazine eject lever.

With this gun, you will receive the cute commie looking holster, one magazine and the original cleaning/disassembly tool as shown in the photos.  The gun is in good condition with only some light holster wear on the bluing.  The holster is also in nice condition.

Face to face only.  This gun is only available to Ohio residents, 21 years or older.

This is the TGI AMD-65 (not the Century build). This has the original Hungarian chrome lined barrel and Hungarian receiver. It has a spot 
welded muzzle brake/barrel extension. This rifle is basically new. I am the 
original owner and shot less than 100 rounds through it. It comes with the 
box, cleaning kit still in package, and Tapco 20 round magazine. 

I changed out the grip to a Tapco SAW type grip and added a Midwest 
Industries AK rail for the purpose of 922r compliance, but I still have the 
original parts and it's an easy swap. 

This gun doesn't have any cant in the sight or gas block that and has never had a FTF or FTE. It shoots well with little muzzle rise (the brake works really well) and is surprisingly accurate. The folding stock is tight. There are a few scratches where the stock folds up on the back of the rear trunnion, but otherwise no scratches. Basically it's new. 

I would like to trade it all as a package for a high quality 9mm of the same value or 1911 in .45 acp (can give boot in the form of mags, ammo or cash,for a good 1911). Prefer Commander or Gov't size. As for rifles, I would trade even for Century vz. 58 will give boot for Czechpoint vz. 58.

title: For Sale:  Spanish FR8 Mauser
postcontent:
FR8 Spanish Mauser 7.62 Nato 

Brief History: Spain was in the process of implementing the CETME assault rifle, however there were not enough CETME's to issue for training. Using stockpiles of older Mauser bolt action rifles (1916 & 1943 models) they developed a rifle that would fill the gap for training purposes until more CETME rifles were produced. The Spanish Special Purpose FR7 & FR8 rifles were born.

This is a light fast handling rifle with minimal recoil. A scout rifle before the scout concept was even thought of. 

Hard to find in this condition. All numbers match.
